Advertise with Forbes Forbes Licensing & Syndication Report a Security Issue Editorial Values and Standards Site Feedback Contact Us Careers at Forbes Tips Corrections Privacy Do Not Sell My Personal Information Terms AdChoices Reprints & Permissions Get in Touch Get In Touch With Mark Walter Get In Touch PROFILE Mark Walter CEO, Guggenheim Partners LLC $7.3B Real Time Net Worth as of 9/10/25 Reflects change since 5 pm ET of prior trading day. #508 in the world today Photo by Javier Rojas/ZUMA Press/Newscom From the Editor Mark Walter is CEO of investment firm Guggenheim Partners, which has more than $300 billion in assets under management. Walter helped found the firm in the late 1990s after he folded his Chicago-based company, Liberty Hampshire, into the Guggenheim family office. A yearlong SEC probe into Guggenheim over controversial real estate deals linked to Walter reportedly ended in 2019 with no penalty. Walter's personal investments include stakes in plant-based food maker Beyond Meat and online car vendor Carvana. In June, Walter agreed to buy a majority stake in the Los Angeles Lakers from the Buss family, in a deal valuing the team at approximately $10 billion. Wealth History HOVER TO REVEAL NET WORTH BY YEAR Forbes Lists #201 Forbes 400 (2025) #581 Billionaires (2025) Personal Stats Age 65 Source of Wealth Finance, asset management, Self Made Self-Made Score 8 Philanthropy Score 2 Residence Chicago, Illinois Citizenship United States Marital Status Married Children 1 Education Bachelor of Arts/Science, Creighton University; Doctor of Jurisprudence, Northwestern University Did you know Walter, who earned a law degree from Northwestern University before going into finance, gave $40 million to the school in 2014. Walter and his wife, Kimbra, own a wildlife preserve in Florida that has a mix of threatened and endangered species. Related People & Companies T. By Megan Poinski Forbes Staff Jun 19, 2025 Lakers Latest Big Sports Franchise Grabbing Private Equity To Keep Pace The Lakers sale, at a $10 billion valuation, is the latest private equity move into premium sports assets. A changing sports TV and league ecosystem will need the money. By David Bloom Senior Contributor Jun 18, 2025 Buss Family Will Sell Lakers To Mark Walter At $10 Billion Valuation—The Most Expensive Sale In Sports History The deal will far exceed the previous record for the largest sports team deal: the $6.1 billion sale of the Boston Celtics earlier this year. By Antonio Pequeño IV Forbes Staff Jun 18, 2025 Buss Family Selling Lakers To Mark Walter For Record $10 Billion \Mark Walter has an agreement to purchase the Los Angeles Lakers for at least $10 billion. If completed, it will be a record price for a sports franchise. By Maury Brown Senior Contributor May 9, 2025 No Surprise: Survey Shows Fans Love MLB Owners Who Spend Big Baseball team owners with the highest payrolls topped a survey of 4,000 baseball fans taken by Canadian website casino.ca. By Dan Schlossberg Senior Contributor Mar 7, 2025 FIA And Formula One Officially Announce Cadillac As Its Newest Team Cadillac and TWG will be the newest team in Formula One as F1 and the FIA "officially" announced it would be the 11th team in the Formula One World Championship in 2026. By Bruce Martin Contributor Jan 16, 2025 Colossal Raises $200 Million From  Dodger Co-Owner, Hollywood Mega Producer Colossal, which is trying to revive the dodo and woolly mammoth, has $10.2 billion valuation after Dodger owner and Legendary founder back company's de-extinction work By David Bloom Senior Contributor Nov 20, 2024 Teton Ridge Acquires The Cowboy Channel, The Cowgirl Channel, Expands Western Sports Footprint Tapping into Western sports and entertainment, Teton Ridge has acquired The Cowboy Channel, The Cowgirl Channel, and streaming platform The Cowboy Channel+. By Maury Brown Senior Contributor Oct 25, 2024 Meet The Billionaire Owners Facing Off In The 2024 World Series The Yankees are in the Fall Classic for the first time since Hal Steinbrenner inherited the team from his famous father. Awaiting them: a Dodgers club backed by all-star investors, including Magic Johnson and a mogul worth $6 billion. By Justin Birnbaum Forbes Staff Jul 6, 2023 Can Mark Walter Group Finalize Plans For Women’s Hockey League By January? Will the Mark Walter Groups attempt at a women's pro hockey league cross the goal line, or hit the post?

I spoke to board member Stan Kasten about what needs to be done. By Erica L. Ayala Former Contributor Jun 30, 2023 Mark Walter Group Acquires PHF, Making Way For #OneLeague In Women’s Hockey It doesn’t have a name yet, but the Professional Women’s Hockey Players Association (PWHPA) will be the official union for the forthcoming league. By Erica L. Ayala Former Contributor May 9, 2022 Chelsea FC Valued At $3.09 Billion In Sale To Group Led By Todd Boehly The sale of Chelsea FC by sanctioned Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich to a group led by Todd Boehly, Clearlake Capital, Mark Walter and Hansjoerg Wyss will carry the second-richest price ever paid for a sports team. By Mike Ozanian Former Staff Apr 8, 2022 Billionaire Dodgers Owner Mark Walter Joins Boehly’s Bid To Takeover Chelsea F.C. MLB’s LA Dodgers principal owner and billionaire Mark Walter has joined American billionaire Todd Boehly’s bid to purchase the English soccer team Chelsea F.C. from Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich, the Athletic reported Friday. WATCH Apr 8, 2022 Billionaire Dodgers Owner Mark Walter Joins Boehly’s Bid To Takeover Chelsea F.C. Four groups are competing to purchase the famed English soccer team from Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich, who is under U.K. sanctions. By Lisa Kim Forbes Staff Jun 27, 2021 Lakers Valued At $5.5 Billion In Anschutz Sale To Dodgers Owners The Los Angeles Lakers were valued at $5.5 billion in the sale of Philip Anschutz’s 27% stake to Los Angeles Dodgers owners Mark Walter and Todd Boehly. By Mike Ozanian Former Staff Sep 30, 2018 Is Billie Jean King The Owner Major League Baseball Has Been Waiting For? The Los Angeles Dodger organization, led by Guggenheim Baseball Management Group Chairman Mark Walter and NBA legend Magic John, announced that Billie Jean King and Ilana Kloss joined its ownership group. Austrian GP: Red Bull Ring Delivers Drama By: Sarah Mitchell The Austrian Grand Prix delivered another thrilling chapter in this season's championship battle. With temperatures soaring above 32Â°C and a packed Red Bull Ring creating an electric atmosphere, the stage was set for an unforgettable race weekend. The podium was decided in the final laps as drivers pushed their machines to the limit. Championship contenders battled wheel-to-wheel while midfield teams capitalized on strategic opportunities. Several rookies impressed with mature drives, earning valuable points for their teams. Key developments emerged throughout the weekend, from aerodynamic updates to strategic innovations. Teams brought significant upgrades to Austria, with varying degrees of success. The technical regulations continue to produce close racing, with multiple teams capable of fighting for podium positions. This weekend's results will impact fantasy leagues across all formats. Driver selections proved crucial as unexpected retirements and strategic gambles created major point swings. Team choices were equally important, with constructor points varying significantly based on reliability and race pace. As teams pack up in Spielberg, attention now turns to Silverstone where the championship battle continues. With just 12 points separating the top three teams in the constructors' standings, every strategic decision and every point scored could prove decisive in this remarkably competitive season.
